longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To consolidate and amend the law relating to the safety of merchant shipping and for purposes connected therewith.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: accepted Convention certificate (獲認可的公約證明書) means a certificate in the form prescribed by the Convention; (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
cargo ship construction and survey regulations (貨船構造及檢驗規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 96;
collision regulations (碰撞規例) means the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Signals of Distress and Prevention of Collisions) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. N); (Replaced 56 of 1990 s. 2)

Convention (公約) means the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea signed in London on 1 November 1974, or any convention that replaces that Convention or any successor convention, as amended from time to time and as applicable to Hong Kong; (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
Convention country (公約國) means, except in Part IV, a country which is a party to the Convention; (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

Convention of 1966 (1966年公約) means the International Convention on Load Lines signed in London on 5 April 1966, or any convention that replaces that Convention or any successor convention, as amended from time to time and as applicable to Hong Kong; (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3)
Convention ship (公約船) means a ship registered in a Convention country and Convention passenger ship (公約客船) is to be construed accordingly; (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
court of survey (驗船法庭) means a court of survey appointed under section 74;

def.name: DangerousGoods
def.leadIn: dangerous goods (危險品) means substances, materials or articles—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that are classified in the IMDG Code as dangerous for carriage by sea; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the properties of which are, in the opinion of the Director, dangerous when carried by sea and the Director has, by notice in the Gazette, declared them to be so,

continued.leadIn: and includes empty receptacles and residues in tanks or cargo holds which have been used previously for the carriage of dangerous goods, unless such receptacles, tanks or cargo holds have, after such use, been—

paragraph.content: cleaned and dried;
gas freed or ventilated where appropriate; or
where the previous contents were radioactive materials, cleaned and adequately closed,

def.continued: but does not include substances, materials or articles forming part of the equipment or stores of a vessel; (Replaced 4 of 2002 s. 13 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.def: Director (處長) means the Director of Marine;
fire-fighting appliances regulations (消防裝置規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 99;

IMDG Code (《規則》) means the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code published by the International Maritime Organization, as amended or revised by the Organization from time to time; (Added 4 of 2002 s. 13 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

def.name: InternationalVoyage
def.leadIn: international voyage (國際航程) means, except in Part IV and subject to subsection (2), a voyage between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Hong Kong and a port outside the People’s Republic of China; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a port in a Convention country and a port outside that Convention country (whether in a Convention country or not); (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.def: life-saving appliances regulations (救生裝置規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 99;
navigational equipment regulations (導航設備規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 98;
owner (船東) includes a charterer by demise;

def.name: Passenger
def.leadIn: passenger (乘客) means any person carried in a ship, except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or engaged in any capacity on board the ship on the business of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person on board the ship either in pursuance of the obligation laid upon the master to carry ship-wrecked, distressed or other persons, or by reason of any circumstances which neither the master nor the owner could have prevented or forestalled; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a child under 1 year of age;

subsection.def: passenger ship (客船) means a ship carrying more than 12 passengers;
passenger ship construction regulations (客船構造規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 94;
radio regulations (無線電規例) means the regulations made, or deemed to be made, under section 97;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Transport and Logistics; (Added 10 of 2009 s. 3. Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
ship (船、船舶) includes any vessel used in navigation other than a vessel propelled by oars or a junk;

tons (噸) and tonnage (噸位) mean tons and tonnage as calculated in accordance with the Merchant Shipping (Registration) (Tonnage) Regulations (Cap. 415 sub. leg. C); (Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
waters of Hong Kong (香港水域) means waters of Hong Kong within the meaning of section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1). (Replaced 26 of 1998 s. 44)

subsection.content: In this Ordinance (except Part IV), for the purposes of the definition of international voyage in subsection (1), no account is to be taken of any deviation by a ship from its intended voyage due solely to stress of weather or any other circumstances that neither the master nor the owner of the ship could have prevented or forestalled. (Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 3 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: Save as otherwise provided in this Ordinance or in regulations made thereunder, this Ordinance shall apply to all ships except— (Amended 56 of 1992 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ships of war;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fishing vessels;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: pleasure vessels; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: local vessels within the meaning of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548) except a local vessel referred to in section 3(4) of that Ordinance. (Replaced 43 of 1999 s. 91)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Survey and Certificates

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: cargo ship safety certificate (貨船安全證明書) means a cargo ship safety certificate issued under section 21A; (Added 6 of 2000 s. 2)
cargo ship safety construction certificate (貨船構造安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 21(1);
cargo ship safety equipment certificate (貨船設備安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 17(1);
cargo ship safety radio certificate (貨船無線電安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 18(1);
declaration of survey (驗船聲明書) means a declaration under section 10 or 11;
general safety certificate (一般安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 15(1) in respect of a passenger ship registered in Hong Kong;

non-international voyage (非國際航程) means a voyage which begins and ends within the waters of Hong Kong, during the course of which the ship concerned does not call at any port outside Hong Kong; (Added 5 of 1993 s. 2)
passenger certificate (乘客定額證明書) means a certificate issued under section 14;
qualified cargo ship safety construction certificate (有限制貨船構造安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 21(3)(a)(ii) or 21(3)(b);
qualified cargo ship safety equipment certificate (有限制貨船設備安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 17(2)(ii);
qualified cargo ship safety radio certificate (有限制貨船無線電安全證明書) means a certificate issued under section 18(2)(ii);
qualified safety certificate (有限制安全證明書) and qualified short voyage safety certificate (有限制短途航程安全證明書) mean a certificate issued under section 15(2)(ii);

def.name: ShortInternationalVoyage
def.leadIn: short international voyage (短途國際航程) means an international voyage—

paragraph.name: a
b

subsection.def: short voyage safety certificate (短途航程安全證明書) means a certificate issued under the proviso to section 15(1).

subsection.content: In this Part, for the purposes of the definition of short international voyage in subsection (1), no account is to be taken of any deviation by a ship from its intended voyage due solely to stress of weather or any other circumstances that neither the master nor the owner of the ship could have prevented or forestalled. (Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 4 and E.R. 5 of 2021)
The Secretary may appoint persons to be Government surveyors for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 38)
Persons appointed as Government surveyors may be appointed as ship surveyors, nautical surveyors, engineer surveyors or radio surveyors, or in more than one of such capacities.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Powers and duties of Government surveyors

subsection.content: For the purpose of ensuring that this Ordinance has been complied with, a Government surveyor may at all reasonable times go on board a ship and inspect the ship and its equipment or any part thereof, any articles on board, and any document carried in the ship in pursuance of this Ordinance, the Merchant Shipping (Registration) Ordinance (Cap. 415) or rules or regulations made thereunder. (Amended 74 of 1990 s. 104; 10 of 2009 s. 5)
In making an inspection under this section, a Government surveyor shall have all the powers conferred by section 115.
A Government surveyor may inspect any ship under this section notwithstanding that it may be exempt from any provision of this Ordinance.

A Government surveyor shall make such returns to the Director as he may require with respect to the build, dimensions, draught, cubic capacity, speed, fuel capacity, and the nature and particulars of machinery and equipment, and specifying the number of the certificated officers and seamen of ships surveyed by him.

The owner, master and engineer of any ship so surveyed shall, on demand, give to the surveyor all such information and assistance within his power as he may require for the purpose of a return under subsection (1).
Any owner, master or engineer who fails without reasonable excuse to comply with a demand under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Approval of organizations to survey ships and issue certificates

subsection.content: The Secretary may approve any organization for the purposes of surveying ships and issuing certificates under this Ordinance.
Every certificate issued by any organization approved by the Secretary under subsection (1) shall have effect for the purposes of this Ordinance as if it had been issued by the Director.
Subject to subsection (2), every passenger ship shall be surveyed at intervals of not more than 12 months in the manner provided in this Part.
Subsection (1) shall not apply to Convention passenger ships plying on international voyages which hold accepted Convention certificates.

No passenger ship shall clear outwards or proceed on any voyage from Hong Kong unless the master has the certificates as to survey required under this Part which are in force and applicable to the voyage on which the ship is about to proceed.
Any passenger ship attempting to go to sea may be detained until the certificates mentioned in subsection (3) are produced to the Director.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Mode of survey and declaration of survey

subsection.content: The owner or master of a passenger ship to which section 9 applies shall have the ship surveyed by a Government surveyor.

The surveyor conducting a survey under subsection (1) shall, if satisfied that he can properly do so, complete a declaration of survey in such form as the Director may approve and forward the completed declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of survey under subsection (2) shall state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the limits, if any, beyond which the ship is not fit to ply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of passengers which the ship is fit to carry, distinguishing, if necessary, the numbers to be carried on the deck and in the cabins,

subsection.continued: and shall, if the circumstances so require, state any conditions and variations, according to the time of year, the nature of the voyage, the cargo carried, or other circumstances to which that number is subject.

subsection.content: If in the opinion of the surveyor a passenger ship is fit to ply on international voyages while engaged in a special trade for the carriage of large numbers of special trade passengers, such as the pilgrim trade, his declaration of survey under subsection (2) shall so state.

A passenger ship (including a Convention passenger ship) which is not registered in Hong Kong plying on a non-international voyage shall be surveyed and certificated further to the requirements equivalent to those which would be applied to a passenger ship which is registered in Hong Kong plying on a non-international voyage, whether such requirements are prescribed under this Ordinance or otherwise, or if not so prescribed, determined according to the Director’s approval under subsection (2). (Added 5 of 1993 s. 3)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Survey of ships other than passenger ships

subsection.content: The owner or master of a ship to which this section applies shall have the ship surveyed to such extent, in such manner and at such intervals as may be prescribed by the cargo ship construction and survey regulations.
The surveyor conducting a survey under subsection (1) shall, if satisfied that he can properly do so, complete a declaration of survey and forward the completed declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ships of not less than 500 tons gross tonnage;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ships of not less than such lower tonnage and of such description as the Director may by order specify; (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ships not registered in Hong Kong only while they are in the waters of Hong Kong and are not exempt from the cargo ship construction and survey regulations,

subsection.continued: other than passenger ships.

subsection.leadIn: If an owner or master is aggrieved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a declaration of a surveyor under this Part, or by the refusal of a surveyor to give the said declaration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the refusal of a certificate of clearance under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the owner or master may appeal, in the manner prescribed by regulations, to a court of survey, and upon its appointment by the Chief Executive such court may make such order with respect to the costs of any such investigation as it thinks fit, and such costs shall be paid accordingly, and shall be recoverable in the same manner as costs in summary proceedings before any magistrate.

subsection.content: On such appeal, the court of survey shall report to the Chief Executive on the question raised by the appeal, and the Chief Executive, when satisfied that the requirements of the report and this Ordinance and any other enactment have been complied with, may require the Director to give the certificates required.

section.name: s13
section.heading: No appeal in certain cases
section.content: Where the survey of a ship is made for the purpose of a declaration under this Part, the person appointed to make the survey shall, if so required by the owner or master, be accompanied on the survey by some competent person appointed by the owner or master, to be approved by the Director, and in such case, if those 2 persons agree, there shall be no appeal to the court of survey as provided by section 12.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Issue of passenger certificate
section.content: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey under section 10 in respect of a passenger ship, is satisfied that this Part has been complied with, he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue a passenger certificate stating such compliance and stating the terms of the declaration in accordance with section 10(3) and (4).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Issue for passenger ships of safety certificates and exemption certificates

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a passenger ship registered in Hong Kong is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the ship complies with the passenger ship construction regulations, the life-saving appliances regulations, the fire-fighting appliances regulations, the radio regulations and the navigational equipment regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is properly provided with the lights, shapes and means of making sound signals required by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship a general safety certificate showing that the ship complies with the requirements of the Convention applicable to such ship and such voyage:
subsection.proviso: Provided that if the voyages on which the ship is to be engaged are short international voyages and it complies only with such of those regulations as are applicable to those voyages, the certificate shall show that the ship complies with the requirements of the Convention applicable to it as a ship plying on short international voyages.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a passenger ship to which subsection (1) applies, is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is exempt, by virtue of any exercise by him of a power in that behalf conferred on him by this Ordinance or conferred on him by regulations made under this Ordinance, from any of the requirements of the passenger ship construction regulations, the life-saving appliances regulations, the fire-fighting appliances regulations, the radio regulations or the navigational equipment regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on, whether short voyages or otherwise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it complies with the rest of those requirements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is properly provided with the lights, shapes and means of making sound signals required by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an exemption certificate stating which of the requirements of the Convention applicable as aforesaid the ship is exempt from and that the exemption is conditional on the ship’s plying only on the voyages and being engaged only in the trades and complying with the other conditions (if any) specified in the certificate; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: a qualified safety certificate or a qualified short voyage safety certificate, as the case may be, showing that the ship complies with the rest of those requirements.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Modification of safety certificate in respect of life-saving appliances

subsection.leadIn: If, on any international voyage, a passenger ship registered in Hong Kong in respect of which a safety certificate is in force has on board a total number of persons less than the number stated in that certificate to be the number for which the life-saving appliances on the ship provide, the Director may, at the request of the owner, agent or master of the ship, issue a memorandum stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of persons carried on the ship on that voyage; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consequent modification which may be made for the purpose of that voyage in the particulars with respect to life-saving appliances stated in the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Any memorandum issued under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be annexed to the certificate to which it relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be submitted to the Director at the end of the voyage to which it relates.

subsection.content: If a memorandum issued under subsection (1) is not submitted to the Director at the end of the voyage to which it relates the master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Issue for cargo ships of safety equipment certificates and exemption certificates

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship registered in Hong Kong not being a passenger ship, is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the ship complies with the life-saving appliances regulations and the fire-fighting appliances regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is properly provided with the lights, shapes and means of making sound signals required by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship a cargo ship safety equipment certificate showing that the ship complies with such of the requirements of the Convention relating to those matters as are applicable as aforesaid.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship to which subsection (1) applies, is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is exempt, by virtue of any exercise by him of a power in that behalf conferred on him by this Ordinance or conferred on him by the life-saving appliances regulations and the fire-fighting appliances regulations, from any of the requirements of those regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it complies with the rest of those requirements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is properly provided with the lights, shapes and means of making sound signals required by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an exemption certificate stating which of the requirements of the Convention, being requirements the subject of the life-saving appliances regulations and the fire-fighting appliances regulations and applicable as aforesaid, the ship is exempt from, and that the exemption is conditional on the ship’s plying only on the voyages and complying with the other conditions (if any) specified in the certificate; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: a qualified cargo ship safety equipment certificate showing that the ship complies with the rest of those requirements.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Issue for cargo ships of radio certificates and exemption certificates

subsection.content: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship registered in Hong Kong not being a passenger ship, is satisfied that the ship complies with the radio regulations and the navigational equipment regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on, he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship a cargo ship safety radio certificate showing that the ship complies with such of the requirements of the Convention relating to radio installations and shipborne navigational equipment as are applicable.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship to which subsection (1) applies, is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the ship is exempt, by virtue of any exercise by him of a power in that behalf conferred on him by this Ordinance or conferred on him by the regulations in question, from any of the requirements of the radio regulations or the navigational equipment regulations applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it complies with the rest of the requirements of those regulations,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an exemption certificate stating which of the requirements of the Convention relating to radio installations and shipborne navigational equipment, being requirements applicable as aforesaid, the ship is exempt from, and that the exemption is conditional on the ship’s plying only on the voyages and complying with the other conditions (if any) specified in the certificate; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: a qualified cargo ship safety radio certificate showing that the ship complies with the rest of those requirements.

subsection.content: Where any ship registered in Hong Kong is wholly exempt from the requirements of the radio regulations and the navigational equipment regulations, the Director shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue an exemption certificate stating that the ship is wholly exempt from the requirements of the Convention relating to radio installations and shipborne navigational equipment and specifying the voyages on which, and conditions (if any) on which, the ship is so exempt.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Issue of general safety certificates, etc. on partial compliance with regulations
section.content: Where a ship complies with all the requirements of the passenger ship construction regulations, the life-saving appliance regulations, the fire-fighting appliances regulations, the radio regulations and the navigational equipment regulations applicable to the ship and to the voyages on which it is to be engaged so far as those requirements are requirements of the Convention applicable as aforesaid, the Director may issue in respect of the ship a general safety certificate, short voyage safety certificate, cargo ship safety equipment certificate or cargo ship safety radio certificate, as the case may be, notwithstanding that it is exempt from, or for some other reason does not comply with, any requirements of those regulations which are not applicable requirements of the Convention.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Cargo ship safety construction certificates and exemption certificates

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is satisfied, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship to which section 11 applies and which is registered in Hong Kong, that the ship complies with the cargo ship construction and survey regulations applicable to the ship and such voyages as it is to be engaged on, he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the ship is of not less than 500 tons gross tonnage and is to be engaged on international voyages, a cargo ship safety construction certificate in the form prescribed by the Convention; (Amended 6 of 2000 s. 5; 10 of 2009 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, a cargo ship safety construction certificate showing that it complies with the said regulations.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director, on receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of such a ship, is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is exempt, by virtue of any exercise by him of a power in that behalf conferred on him by this Ordinance or the cargo ship construction and survey regulations, from any of the requirements of those regulations applicable to the ship and to such voyages as it is to be engaged on; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it complies with the rest of those requirements,

subsection.continued: he shall, on the application of the owner, agent or master, issue specified certificates in respect of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The specified certificates referred to in subsection (2) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the ship is of not less than 500 tons gross tonnage and is to be engaged on international voyages—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an exemption certificate stating which of the requirements of the Convention, being requirements implemented by the regulations and applicable as aforesaid, the ship is exempt from and that the exemption is conditional on the ship’s plying on the voyages and complying with the other conditions (if any) specified in the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a qualified cargo ship safety construction certificate showing that the ship complies with the rest of those requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, a qualified cargo ship safety construction certificate showing that the ship complies with such of the requirements of the cargo ship construction and survey regulations applicable to the ship and to the voyages it is to be engaged on as it is not exempt from.

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Issue of cargo ship safety certificates

subsection.leadIn: If on—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the application of the owner, agent or master of the ship,

subsection.continued: the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: the ship complies with—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the life-saving appliances regulations;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the fire-fighting appliances regulations;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the radio regulations;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: the navigational equipment regulations; and

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: the cargo ship construction and survey regulations,

paragraph.continued: applicable to the ship and to such international voyages as it is to be engaged on; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the ship is properly provided with the lights, shapes, and means of making sound signals required by the collision regulations,

subsection.continued: he may issue in respect of the ship a cargo ship safety certificate showing that the ship complies with such of the requirements of the Convention relating to the matters specified in paragraph (ii) and to the matters for which the regulations set out in paragraph (i) are made.

subsection.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, any reference in this Ordinance to a cargo ship safety equipment certificate, a cargo ship safety radio certificate or a cargo ship safety construction certificate shall, where a cargo ship safety certificate has been issued in respect of a ship, be construed in relation to that ship as a reference to the cargo ship safety certificate, and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.
Nothing in this section shall derogate from the power to issue a certificate under section 17(1), 18(1) or 21(1).

The Director shall, upon the completion of any certificate under this Part, deliver such certificate in duplicate to the owner, agent or master applying for the certificate upon the payment of such fees as may be prescribed.
Any declaration of survey shall be produced for the inspection of the owner, agent or master of the ship to which the declaration relates.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Notice of alterations and additional surveys

subsection.leadIn: The owner or master of a ship in respect of which any certificate issued under this Part is in force shall, as soon as possible, after any alteration is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the ship’s hull, equipment or machinery affecting the efficiency thereof or the seaworthiness of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the appliances or equipment required by the life-saving appliances regulations, the fire-fighting appliances regulations, the radio regulations, the navigational equipment regulations or the collision regulations to be carried by the ship, being an alteration affecting the efficiency or completeness of those appliances or equipment,

subsection.continued: give written notice to the Director containing full particulars of the alteration.

subsection.content: If notice of any alteration is not given as required by this section, the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reason to believe that since the making of the last declaration of survey in respect of any ship to which subsection (1) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any such alteration has been made as is mentioned in subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hull, equipment or machinery of the ship have sustained any damage or are otherwise insufficient; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the appliances or equipment of the ship referred to in subsection (1)(b) have sustained any damage or are otherwise insufficient,

subsection.continued: he may, without prejudice to his powers under section 27, require the ship to be surveyed again as he thinks fit, and, if such requirement is not complied with, may cancel any certificate issued in respect of the ship under this Part.

subsection.content: The power of the Director under subsection (3) to cancel a certificate shall be exercisable also where a ship has not been submitted for survey as required by the cargo ship construction and survey regulations.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, alteration (改動) in relation to anything includes the renewal of any part of it.

subsection.leadIn: Where a certificate is issued in respect of a ship under this Part, the owner or master of the ship shall ensure that the certificate is kept readily available on board the ship, so long as the certificate remains in force and the ship is in use, for inspection at all reasonable times by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when the ship is in Hong Kong, a Government surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the ship is in a port in a Convention country, any person duly authorized for that purpose by the government of that Convention country. (Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 10 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is not complied with, the owner or master concerned commits an offence unless he has a reasonable excuse, and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compliance by the owner or master shall be deemed to be compliance by both of them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an owner or master does not have a reasonable excuse by reason only that he has delegated his responsibility to his agent.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Prohibition on proceeding to sea without appropriate certificates

subsection.leadIn: No ship registered in Hong Kong shall proceed to sea on an international voyage unless there is in force in respect of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is a passenger ship, a passenger certificate, a general safety certificate, a short voyage safety certificate, a qualified safety certificate or a qualified short voyage safety certificate which, subject to subsection (5), is applicable to the voyage on which the ship is about to proceed and to the trade in which it is for the time being engaged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if it is a ship to which section 11 applies—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a cargo ship safety equipment certificate or a qualified cargo ship safety equipment certificate; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a cargo ship safety radio certificate or a qualified cargo ship safety radio certificate or an exemption certificate stating that it is wholly exempt from the requirements of the Convention relating to radio installations and shipborne navigational equipment; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a cargo ship safety construction certificate or a qualified cargo ship safety construction certificate; or (Replaced 6 of 2000 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a cargo ship safety certificate, (Replaced 6 of 2000 s. 7)

paragraph.continued: applicable to the ship and the voyage on which it is about to proceed.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(b) shall not prohibit a ship from proceeding to sea if there is in force in respect of the ship such certificate or certificates as would be required if it were a passenger ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a qualified certificate shall not be deemed to be in force in respect of a ship unless there is also in force in respect of the ship the corresponding exemption certificate; and an exemption certificate shall be of no effect unless it is by its terms applicable to the voyage on which the ship is about to proceed.

subsection.content: If any ship proceeds, or attempts to proceed to sea in contravention of this section the owner or master of the ship, without prejudice to any other penalty under this Ordinance, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

The owner, agent or master of any ship to which this section applies shall produce to the Director, at the time a clearance for the ship is demanded for an international voyage, the certificate or certificates required under this section to be in force when the ship proceeds to sea; and a clearance shall not be granted, and the ship may be detained, until such certificate or certificates are produced.

Where the Director permits any passenger ship in respect of which there is in force a short voyage safety certificate, whether qualified or not, to proceed to sea on an international voyage from Hong Kong not exceeding 1 200 nautical miles in length between Hong Kong and the final port of destination, the certificate shall for the purposes of this section be deemed to be applicable to the voyage on which the ship is about to proceed notwithstanding that the voyage exceeds 600 nautical miles between Hong Kong and such port.

Where an exemption certificate issued in respect of any ship registered in Hong Kong specifies any conditions on which the certificate is issued and any of those conditions is not complied with, the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s25A
section.heading: Prohibition on certain ships proceeding to sea unless relevant regulations complied with

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to and only to a ship which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not a passenger ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of less than 500 tons gross tonnage;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vessel required to be certificated under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548). (Replaced 43 of 1999 s. 91)

subsection.content: A ship to which this section applies shall not proceed to sea on an international voyage unless the ship complies with the relevant regulations.

The master of a ship to which this section applies shall, at the time a clearance for the ship is demanded in respect of an international voyage from Hong Kong, produce to the Director documentary evidence to his satisfaction that the ship complies with the relevant regulations and a clearance shall not be granted and the ship may be detained until such documentary evidence is produced.

Where a ship to which this section applies proceeds, or attempts to proceed to sea in contravention of subsection (2), the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.def: In this section relevant regulations (有關規例) means regulations made for the purposes of this section under this Ordinance or under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548) and applicable to the class of ship to which the ship belongs. (Amended 43 of 1999 s. 91)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4) and section 29, a passenger certificate shall remain in force for 1 year from the date of its issue or for such shorter period as may be specified in the certificate.

Subject to subsections (3A) and (4) and section 29, a general safety certificate shall remain in force for 1 year from its date of issue or for such shorter period as may be specified in the certificate.

Subject to subsections (3A) and (4) and section 29, a cargo ship safety equipment certificate, a cargo ship safety radio certificate, a cargo ship safety construction certificate or a cargo ship safety certificate, shall remain in force for 5 years from the date of its issue or for such shorter period as may be specified in the certificate. (Replaced 6 of 2000 s. 9)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a survey of a ship is completed within 3 months before the date of expiry of a certificate referred to in subsection (2) or (3) issued in respect of the ship, any corresponding certificate issued in consequence of the survey shall be valid from the date of completion of the survey to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a general safety certificate, a date within 1 year from the date of expiry of the first-mentioned certificate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in subsection (3), a date within 5 years from the date of expiry of the first-mentioned certificate,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a survey of a ship is completed on a date earlier than 3 months before the date of expiry of a certificate referred to in subsection (2) or (3) issued in respect of the ship, any corresponding certificate issued in consequence of the survey shall be valid from the date of completion of the survey to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a general safety certificate, a date within 1 year from the date of completion of the survey;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in subsection (3), a date within 5 years from the date of completion of the survey,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a survey of a ship is completed after the date of expiry of a certificate referred to in subsection (2) or (3) issued in respect of the ship, any corresponding certificate issued in consequence of the survey shall be valid from the date of completion of the survey to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a general safety certificate, a date within 1 year from the date of expiry of the first-mentioned certificate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in subsection (3), a date within 5 years from the date of expiry of the first-mentioned certificate,

paragraph.continued: specified in the corresponding certificate. (Added 6 of 2000 s. 9)

subsection.content: No certificate referred to in subsection (1), (2) or (3) shall remain in force after notice is given by the Director to the owner or master of the ship in respect of which it has been issued that the Director has cancelled the certificate.
An exemption certificate shall remain in force for the same period as the corresponding qualified certificate.

If any ship is absent from Hong Kong at the time of expiry of any certificate issued under this Part, no penalty shall be incurred until the ship commences a voyage after the next departure from any port.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel any certificate issued in respect of any ship under this Part, where he has reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any declaration of survey on which the certificate was founded has in any material particular been made fraudulently or erroneously;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate has been issued upon false or erroneous information;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: since the making of the declaration of survey, the hull, equipment or machinery of the ship has or have sustained any damage or is or are otherwise insufficient;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any condition on which the certificate has been issued has been contravened;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the master of the ship is not exercising, or is not permitted to exercise, proper control of the ship.

subsection.content: Where a certificate is cancelled under subsection (1) the Director may require the owner or master of the ship to which the certificate referred to have the hull, equipment or machinery of the ship again surveyed and may require the surveyor to complete a further declaration of survey before he re-issues the certificate or issues a fresh one in place thereof.
The Director may require any certificate issued under this Part which has expired or has been cancelled to be delivered up as he directs.
Any owner or master who fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

The Director may, on the application of the owner, agent or master of a ship registered in Hong Kong in respect of which a certificate has been issued under this Part, grant an extension of the certificate for a period not exceeding 1 month from the date of expiry of the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: If on the date of expiry of a certificate issued under this Part in respect of a ship registered in Hong Kong, the ship is not in the port in which it is to be surveyed, the Director may, on the application of the owner, agent or master of the ship, grant an extension of the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of allowing the ship to complete its voyage to that port; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a period not exceeding 3 months from the date of expiry of the certificate.

subsection.content: Where a survey of a ship has been completed but a certificate issued or to be issued under this Part in respect of the ship in consequence of the survey cannot be placed on board the ship before the date of expiry of an existing certificate to which the first-mentioned certificate corresponds, the Director may endorse on the existing certificate the fact that such survey has been completed or cause such certificate to be so endorsed, and such certificate so endorsed shall be regarded as valid for such further period not exceeding 5 months from the date of its expiry as may be specified in the endorsement.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (1), (2) and (3), if on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receipt of a declaration of survey in respect of a ship in respect of which a certificate issued under section 17(1), 18(1), 21(1) or 21A(1) is in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application of the owner, agent or master of the ship,

subsection.continued: the Director is satisfied that it is proper to do so, the Director may grant an extension of the certificate for a period which, together with the period for which the certificate was issued and any period by which the certificate has been previously extended under this subsection, does not exceed 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: Where a survey of a ship is completed after the expiry of a certificate issued under this Part in respect of the ship, any corresponding certificate issued in consequence of the survey shall remain in force for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a general safety certificate, such period not exceeding 1 year from the date of completion of the survey;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in section 26(3), such period not exceeding 5 years from the date of completion of the survey,

subsection.continued: as the Director may consider appropriate in the special circumstances of the case and as may be specified in the corresponding certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an extension of a certificate issued in respect of a ship has been granted under subsection (1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a survey of the ship is completed,

subsection.continued: any corresponding certificate issued in consequence of the survey shall remain in force for—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of a general safety certificate, such period not exceeding 1 year from the date of completion of the survey;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in section 26(3), such period not exceeding 5 years from the date of completion of the survey,

subsection.continued: as the Director may consider appropriate in the special circumstances of the case and as may be specified in the corresponding certificate.

subsection.content: Any general safety certificate or short voyage safety certificate, whether qualified or not, may be combined in one document with a passenger certificate.

Any certificate issued by the Director under this Part may be signed on his behalf by any person authorized by him for the purpose, and a certificate purporting to be so signed shall be admissible in evidence in like manner as if it had been signed by the Director.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Issue or endorsement of certificate at request of Director

subsection.leadIn: The Director may request the government of a Convention country to cause a ship registered in Hong Kong to which this Part applies to be surveyed and to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue or authorize the issue of, in respect of the ship, any certificate that the Director may issue under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where appropriate, endorse or authorize the endorsement of any such certificate issued in respect of the ship in accordance with the Convention.

subsection.content: A certificate issued pursuant to a request under subsection (1) and containing a statement that it has been so issued has effect for the purposes of this Part as if the certificate had been issued by the Director.

For the purposes of this Part, an endorsement made on the certificate by the government of a Convention country on behalf of the Director in conformity with the Convention has the same effect as an endorsement made by the Director under this Part.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Forgery of certificates

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowingly and wilfully makes, or assists in making, or procures to be made, a false or fraudulent declaration or certificate required by or under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forges, assists in forging, procures to be forged, fraudulently alters, assists in fraudulently altering, or procures to be fraudulently altered, any such declaration or certificate, or anything contained in, or any signature to any such declaration or certificate,

section.continued: he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Certificates of Convention ships not registered in Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, at the request of the government of a Convention country, cause a ship registered in that Convention country to be surveyed and, if the Director is satisfied that the requirements of the Convention are complied with, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue or authorize the issue of, in respect of the ship, any certificate the issue of which in respect of a ship registered in Hong Kong is authorized under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where appropriate, endorse or authorize the endorsement of any such certificate issued in respect of the ship in accordance with the Convention. (Replaced 10 of 2009 s. 12 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.name: 1A

subsection.leadIn: A Government surveyor, for the purpose of verifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that there is in force in respect of a Convention ship not registered in Hong Kong an accepted Convention certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the condition of the hull, equipment and machinery of any such Convention ship corresponds substantially with the particulars shown in such a certificate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: except where such a certificate states that the ship is wholly exempt from the provisions of the Convention relating to radio installations and shipborne navigational equipment, that the number, grades and qualifications of radio officers or operators on board correspond with those shown in the certificate; or (Amended 6 of 2000 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that any conditions on which such a certificate, being the equivalent of an exemption certificate, is issued are complied with,

subsection.continued: shall have all the powers conferred by section 115.

subsection.leadIn: Where there is attached to an accepted Convention certificate in respect of a Convention passenger ship not registered in Hong Kong a memorandum which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued by or under the authority of the government of the country in which the ship is registered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modifies for the purpose of any particular voyage, in view of the number of persons carried on that voyage, the particulars stated in the certificate with respect to life-saving appliances,

subsection.continued: the certificate shall have effect for the purpose of that voyage as if it were modified in accordance with the memorandum.

subsection.leadIn: Where an accepted Convention certificate is produced in respect of a Convention passenger ship not registered in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship, unless it is plying on a non-international voyage, shall not be required to be surveyed under this Ordinance by a Government surveyor except for the purpose of determining the number of passengers that it is fit to carry; (Amended 5 of 1993 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on receipt of any declaration of survey for the purpose aforesaid, the Director shall issue a certificate containing only the statement of the particulars relating to the number of passengers the ship is fit to carry; and a certificate so issued shall have effect as a passenger certificate.

subsection.content: Where there is produced in respect of any such passenger ship as aforesaid an accepted Convention certificate, and also a certificate issued by or under the authority of the government of the country in which the ship is registered showing the number of passengers that the ship is fit to carry, and the Director is satisfied that that number has been determined substantially in the same manner as in the case of a passenger ship registered in Hong Kong, he may if he thinks fit dispense with any survey of the ship for the purpose of determining the number of passengers that it is fit to carry and direct that the last-mentioned certificate shall have effect as a passenger certificate.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Further provisions as to the production of Convention certificates

subsection.content: The master of every Convention ship not registered in Hong Kong shall produce to the Director, at the time a clearance for the ship is demanded in respect of an international voyage from Hong Kong, accepted Convention certificates that are the equivalent of the certificates issued by the Director under this Ordinance that would be required to be in force in respect of the ship if it were a ship registered in Hong Kong; and a clearance shall not be granted, and the ship may be detained, until such certificates are so produced.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Director may for the purposes of a clearance for a ship in respect of an international voyage or a non-international voyage accept any certificate, not being an accepted Convention certificate, where he is satisfied that any standards relating to safety required to be complied with for the issue of such a certificate are substantially the same as those required for a certificate issued by the Director for a ship registered in Hong Kong under this Ordinance or issued by him under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548) for a ship which is a vessel required to be certificated under that Ordinance. (Added 5 of 1993 s. 6. Amended 43 of 1999 s. 91)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 33 an accepted Convention certificate being the equivalent of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a qualified certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exemption certificate, other than a certificate under section 18(3),

subsection.continued: shall not be accepted unless there is also produced the corresponding exemption certificate or qualified certificate, as the case may be.

section.name: s34A
section.heading: Production of documentary evidence of compliance with certificate requirements

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to and only to a ship which is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship holding an accepted Convention certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a passenger ship;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vessel required to be certificated under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548).

subsection.leadIn: The master of a ship to which this section applies shall, at the time a clearance for the ship is demanded in respect of an international voyage or a non-international voyage, produce to the Director documentary evidence to his satisfaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a ship of not less than 500 tons gross tonnage, of compliance with the requirements that would, if it were a ship holding an accepted Convention certificate, be required to be complied with for the purposes of section 34(1) or (1A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a ship—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of less than 500 tons gross tonnage; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of the same size as a vessel required to be certificated under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548),

paragraph.continued: of compliance with the requirements that would, if it were a ship of the same description registered in Hong Kong, be required to be complied with for the purposes of section 25A(1),

subsection.continued: and a clearance shall not be granted and the ship may be detained until such documentary evidence is produced.

part.crossHeading: Exemption of certain ships from this Part

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 25A and 34A, nothing in this Part— (Amended 5 of 1993 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting or preventing a ship from proceeding to sea unless there are in force in relation to the ship, or are produced, the appropriate certificates issued by the Director under this Part or the appropriate accepted Convention certificates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conferring powers on a Government surveyor for the purpose of verifying the existence, validity or correctness of any Convention certificate or that the conditions on which any such certificate was issued are complied with,

subsection.continued: shall apply to any ship of less than 500 tons gross tonnage other than a passenger ship.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not prevent the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any ship of 300 tons gross tonnage or above, of so much of the provisions referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that subsection as relates to certificates issued under section 18 or equivalent accepted Convention certificates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any ship to which section 11 applies and which is registered in Hong Kong, of so much of the provisions referred to in paragraph (a) of that subsection as relates to certificates issued under section 21,

subsection.continued: by reason only that it is of less than 500 tons gross tonnage.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding that any provision of this Part is expressed to apply to ships not registered in Hong Kong while they are within the waters of Hong Kong, that provision shall not apply to a ship that would not be within such waters but for stress of weather or any other circumstance that neither the master nor the owner of the ship could have prevented or forestalled.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Certificates and Log-books in Electronic Form

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IIA
section.def: approved organization (獲批准機構) means an organization approved by the Secretary under section 8(1);
certifying authority (核證當局) means—(a)the Director; or(b)an approved organization;

listed certificate (表列證書) means—(a)a document listed in column 2 of the Table in Division 1 of Part 2 of the Schedule that is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document; or(b)a document listed in column 2 of that Table the subject matter of which is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the document;

listed log-book (表列航海日誌) means a log-book listed in column 2 of the Table in Division 2 of Part 2 of the Schedule that is referred to in a provision listed in column 3 of that Table corresponding to the log-book.

section.name: s35B
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Part and the Schedule apply to a ship registered in Hong Kong.

section.name: s35C
section.heading: Listed certificates may be issued electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate that may be issued by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
A listed certificate may be issued by a certifying authority in electronic form.
A listed certificate is considered as issued in electronic form only if it is issued in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.
A certifying authority must cause a listed certificate issued by it in accordance with this section to be kept in the e-cert database.

section.name: s35D
section.heading: Listed certificates may be endorsed electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate that may be endorsed by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
A listed certificate may be endorsed by a certifying authority in electronic form.
A listed certificate is considered as endorsed in electronic form only if the endorsement is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.
A certifying authority must cause an endorsement made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s35E
section.heading: Validity of listed certificates may be extended electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate the validity of which may be extended by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
The validity of a listed certificate may be extended by a certifying authority in electronic form.
The validity of a listed certificate is considered as extended in electronic form only if the extension is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.
A certifying authority must cause an extension made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s35F
section.heading: Validity of listed certificates may be suspended electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate the validity of which may be suspended by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
The validity of a listed certificate may be suspended by a certifying authority in electronic form.
The validity of a listed certificate is considered as suspended in electronic form only if the suspension is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.

If the validity of a listed certificate is suspended in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up the certificate on the suspension of its validity is regarded as having been met and physical delivery of the certificate is no longer required.
A certifying authority must cause a suspension made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s35G
section.heading: Validity of listed certificates may be restored electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate the validity of which may be restored by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
The validity of a listed certificate may be restored by a certifying authority in electronic form.
The validity of a listed certificate is considered as restored in electronic form only if the restoration is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.

If the validity of a listed certificate is restored in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for returning the certificate on the restoration of its validity is regarded as having been met and physical return of the certificate is no longer required.
A certifying authority must cause a restoration made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s35H
section.heading: Listed certificates may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn electronically

subsection.content: This section applies to a listed certificate that may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn by a certifying authority under a provision of this Ordinance.
A listed certificate may be cancelled, revoked or withdrawn by a certifying authority in electronic form.

A listed certificate is considered as cancelled, revoked or withdrawn in electronic form only if the cancellation, revocation or withdrawal is made in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-cert guidelines.

If a listed certificate is cancelled, revoked or withdrawn in electronic form, the requirement under any provision of this Ordinance for delivering up the certificate on its cancellation, revocation or withdrawal is regarded as having been met and physical delivery of the certificate is no longer required.
A certifying authority must cause a cancellation, revocation or withdrawal made by it in accordance with this section to be entered in the e-cert database with respect to the listed certificate.

section.name: s35I
section.heading: Exhibiting and keeping of listed certificates electronically by making them available for viewing from electronic device on board

subsection.leadIn: If the exhibiting or keeping of a listed certificate, or a copy of the certificate, on board the ship to which the certificate relates is required under a provision of this Ordinance, the requirement is also met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by making the certificate readily accessible for viewing from an electronic device on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the device is not functioning properly—by producing a printout of the certificate on board the ship.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: exhibiting (陳示), in relation to a document, includes the display or posting up of the document;
printout (打印本) includes a copy of a printout.

section.name: s35J
section.heading: Making and keeping of entries and records in listed log-books electronically
section.leadIn: If an entry or record is required to be made or kept in a listed log-book under a provision of this Ordinance, the requirement is also met by making or keeping the entry or record in the log-book in electronic form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in an electronic device on board the ship to which the log-book relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the applicable requirements set out in the e-log guidelines.

section.name: s35K
section.heading: Power of Secretary to amend Schedule

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule.

A notice published under subsection (1) may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, savings or transitional provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of the amendments made under that subsection.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Equipment of Ships and Excess Passengers

subsection.leadIn: Every passenger ship to which section 9 applies shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have the ship’s compasses properly adjusted from time to time, to the satisfaction of a Government surveyor and in accordance with regulations or such directions as may be issued by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be provided with such shelter for the protection of deck passengers, if any, as the Director, having regard to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the passage;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of deck passengers to be carried;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the season of the year;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the safety of the ship; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other circumstance,

subsection.leadIn: If any passenger ship to which section 9 applies goes to sea from Hong Kong without having its compasses adjusted or without protection for deck passengers in contravention of subsection (1), the owner or the master commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the owner, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the master, to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.content: If any requirement of this section or of regulations as to the number of permissible passengers is not complied with in the case of any passenger ship, the Director shall not grant a clearance and if any such ship attempts to go to sea without a clearance, the Director may detain it.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Restriction to decks on which passengers may be carried

subsection.content: A ship shall not carry passengers on more than one deck below the water line.
The owner and master of any ship which carries passengers in contravention of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A ship shall not within the waters of Hong Kong carry any passengers in excess of the number allowed by the passenger certificate, or, where the ship has no passenger certificate, the ship shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry any passengers if the ship is not fit to do so under the provisions of this Ordinance, or would not be fit to do so under those provisions if they applied to the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry any passengers in excess of the maximum number which the ship is fit to carry under the provisions of this Ordinance, or would be fit to carry under those provisions if they applied to the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The owner, agent and master of any ship which carries passengers in contravention of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to imprisonment for 2 years and to a fine of $10,000 and an additional fine of $5,000 for each excess passenger.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section every person carried in a ship, other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or engaged in any capacity on board the ship on the business of the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child under 1 year of age,

subsection.continued: shall, until the contrary is proved, be presumed to be a passenger on that ship.

subsection.content: Where the Director for the purpose of enabling persons to be moved from any place in consequence of a threat to their lives has permitted more persons to be carried on board a ship than are permitted under this Ordinance other than this section, the carriage of that excess of persons shall not be an offence under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The owner or agent of any ship shall not be guilty of an offence under subsection (2) if he proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the passengers involved in the offence were shipped without his knowledge or consent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he derived no profit, benefit or advantage from the shipping of the passengers.

subsection.content: In any proceedings for an offence under this section, a certificate purporting to be signed and issued by the Director for the purposes of this subsection shall be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof; and unless it is proved that the certificate has not been signed by the Director, it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that any statement therein to the following effect is true, that is to say a statement that a ship is not fit to carry passengers under the provisions of this Ordinance or would not be fit to do so under those provisions if they applied to the ship, or a statement of the maximum number of passengers a ship is fit to carry under the provisions of this Ordinance or would be fit to do so under those provisions if they applied to the ship.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Director may refuse clearance of ship carrying excess passengers

subsection.content: The master of every ship shall, on application to the Director for a port clearance, state the number of passengers he proposes to carry on the voyage; and if such number is in excess of the number allowed by the passenger certificate or exceeds 12 in the case of a ship which is not provided with a passenger certificate, the Director may refuse clearance.

subsection.leadIn: Any master of a ship who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in an application under subsection (1) for a port clearance intentionally misrepresents the number of passengers proposed to be carried; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leaves or attempts to leave any port in Hong Kong without a clearance,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.content: The master of any ship who, after having obtained a port clearance, leaves or attempts to leave the waters of Hong Kong with any number of passengers greater than that allowed by the clearance commits an offence and is liable to imprisonment for 6 months and to a fine of $10,000 and an additional fine of $5,000 in respect of each passenger in excess of the number permitted by the clearance.

subsection.leadIn: Whenever the master of a ship is guilty of an offence under subsection (3), the owner and agent (if any) of the ship shall each be guilty of the same offence and shall each be liable to the same penalty as is prescribed for that offence, unless he proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the passengers involved in the offence were shipped without his knowledge or consent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he derived no profit, benefit or advantage from the shipping of the passengers.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse a clearance to any ship carrying more than 12 passengers, except on the production of the passenger certificate, being a certificate in force and applicable to the voyage on which the ship is about to proceed; and he may detain such ship until such certificate is produced.
The Director may by order prohibit the conveyance of deck passengers by any ship.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Prohibition on increasing weight on safety valve
section.content: Any person who places an undue weight on the safety valve of any steamship or increases the weight on such safety valve beyond the limits fixed by a Government surveyor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: No ship registered in Hong Kong, being a ship over 150 tons gross tonnage, shall proceed to sea on an international voyage unless the ship is provided with an efficient signalling lamp.
If any ship proceeds or attempts to proceed to sea in contravention of this section, the owner or master thereof commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: No ship registered in Hong Kong shall have on board as part of its equipment an anchor or cable unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the anchor or cable has been marked, and a certificate in respect of it has been issued, in accordance with the regulations made under section 103; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the anchor or cable is one to which those regulations do not apply by virtue of any regulation made under paragraph (e) of section 103(1).

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened in respect of any ship the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

If any person applies to any anchor or cable which has not passed the tests prescribed by regulations made under section 103 any mark prescribed by those regulations for denoting that it has passed those tests, or any other mark calculated to suggest that it has passed those tests, he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.def: In this section, anchor (錨) and cable (錨鏈) have the meanings assigned to them by section 103(2).

section.name: s43
section.heading: Duties of owners and masters as to carrying life-saving appliances and fire-fighting appliances
section.content: It shall be the duty of the owner and master of every ship registered in Hong Kong to ensure that such ship is provided with such life-saving appliances and fire-fighting appliances as may be prescribed by the life-saving appliances regulations and the fire-fighting appliances regulations.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Penalty for breach of life-saving appliances regulations and fire-fighting appliances regulations
section.leadIn: In the case of any ship—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: if the master wilfully neglects to replace or repair, on the first opportunity, any such appliance lost or damaged in the course of the voyage;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if such appliances are not kept so as to be at all times fit and ready for use; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if any provision of the life-saving appliances regulations or the fire-fighting appliances regulations is contravened or not complied with,
