paragraph.content: in the case of a ship registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other ship while the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subsection.content: For the purpose of securing compliance with the deck cargo regulations any person authorized in that behalf by the Director may inspect any ship to which Part IV applies which is carrying cargo in any uncovered space on its deck; and for the purposes of any such inspection any such person shall have all the powers conferred by section 115.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Nuclear ship regulations
section.text: The Secretary may make regulations with respect to ships provided with nuclear power plants for the purpose of enabling effect to be given to the provisions of Chapter VIII of the Annex to the Convention.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations— (Amended 20 of 1996 s. 9; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 38)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for securing the safety of Hong Kong ships and persons on them and for protecting the health of persons on Hong Kong ships; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for giving effect to any provisions of an international agreement applicable to Hong Kong so far as the agreement relates to the safety of other ships or persons on them or to the protection of the health of persons on other ships.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), regulations made under that subsection may in particular provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the design, construction, maintenance, repair, alteration, inspection, surveying and marking of ships and their machinery and equipment;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the carrying out of any operation involving a ship;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the arrangements for ensuring communication between persons in different parts of a ship and between persons in the ship and other persons;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the access to, presence in and egress from a ship, and different parts of it, of persons of any description;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the ventilation, temperature and lighting of different parts of a ship;

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: the steps to be taken to prevent, detect and deal with outbreaks of fire on a ship;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the steps to be taken to prevent any collision involving a ship and in consequence of any collision involving a ship;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the steps to be taken, in a case where a ship is in distress or stranded or wrecked, for the purpose of saving the ship and its machinery, equipment and cargo and the lives of persons on or from the ship, including the steps to be taken by other persons for giving assistance in such a case;

paragraph.name: l
m
n
o
p
paragraph.content: the furnishing of information;

paragraph.name: q
r
paragraph.content: the alteration or cancellation of any such exemption;

paragraph.name: s
t
v
paragraph.content: generally carrying into effect this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provision for different circumstances and, in particular, make provision for an individual case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in such circumstances as are prescribed by the regulations;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply to Hong Kong ships wherever they may be; (Added 56 of 1990 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide that the contravention of any particular regulation shall be an offence and may prescribe penalties for any such offence not exceeding a fine at level 4 or imprisonment for 2 years or both such fine and such imprisonment. (Amended 56 of 1990 s. 12; E.R. 5 of 2021; E.R. 1 of 2022)

subsection.def: In this section ship (船、船舶) includes a junk and a trawler to which Part XII of the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281) applies, and Hong Kong ship (香港船舶) means a ship registered in Hong Kong. (Amended 56 of 1990 s. 12)

subsection.content: The Secretary may make regulations specifying such charts, directions or information as are necessary or expedient for the safe operation of ships, and those regulations may require ships registered in Hong Kong, or such class of ships registered in Hong Kong as may be specified in the regulations, to carry, either at all times or on such voyages as may be specified in the regulations, copies of the charts, directions or information so specified. (Amended 20 of 1996 s. 9; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 38)

If a ship goes to sea, or attempts to go to sea without carrying copies of the charts, directions or information which it is required to carry by regulations under this section, the owner or master of the ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s109
section.heading: Regulations as to procedure, fees, etc. in courts of survey
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to provide for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance with respect to a court of survey and appeals thereto, and in particular with respect to the summoning of and procedure before the court, the requiring of security for costs and damages on an appeal under section 12 or section 68 and the amount and application of fees.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Regulations as to fees and surveys

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations prescribing the fees to be paid for any inspection carried out by a Government surveyor under any power conferred by this Ordinance and in respect of any certificate issued by the Director under this Ordinance. (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 30)
Any fees payable under regulations made under subsection (1) shall be paid to the Government. (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) shall not apply to any fee paid in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a survey or inspection which is carried out otherwise than by a Government surveyor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate issued otherwise than by the Director under this Ordinance.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations prescribing— (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount and payment of fees due and of any travelling or other expenses incurred by Government surveyors in the execution of their duties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the payment of fees in respect of any supervision or inspection, and in respect of the issue of certificates under regulations made under section 103; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fees in respect of any service or matter provided for in regulations made under section 107. (Added 20 of 1996 s. 5)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section by the Financial Secretary may amend— (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Ship’s Manning) Regulation (Cap. 369 sub. leg. AS)— (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 95)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in section 4(1), by repealing “Schedule 2” and substituting “regulations made under section 110 of the Ordinance”; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by repealing Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Cargo Ship Safety Equipment Survey) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. T)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in regulation 6(2), by repealing “Schedule 3” and substituting “regulations made under section 110 of the Ordinance”; and (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by repealing Schedule 3. (Added 20 of 1996 s. 5)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: The Secretary may make regulations prescribing the persons by whom and the conditions under which any such payments as are mentioned in subsection (3A)(a) shall be made. (Added 20 of 1996 s. 5. Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 30)

subsection.name: 3D
subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the amendments made to this Ordinance by the Merchant Shipping (Safety) (Amendment) Ordinance 1996 (20 of 1996) shall not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the previous operation of any power under this Ordinance to prescribe fees; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operation of any power given to the Director under section 112A(1)(a). (Added 20 of 1996 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may issue instructions to Government surveyors and may make regulations— (Amended 20 of 1996 s. 9; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specifying the manner in which surveys of ships are to be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the notice to be given to Government surveyors when surveys are required. (Amended 20 of 1996 s. 5)

section.name: s112
section.heading: Penalties under regulations
section.content: Save as otherwise provided, any regulations made under this Ordinance may provide that a contravention of specified provisions thereof shall be an offence and may prescribe penalties therefor not exceeding $20,000 and 2 years imprisonment.

section.name: s112A
section.heading: Power of Director to amend Schedules, prescribe specifications etc., issue instructions, directions or codes of practice and approve forms

subsection.leadIn: Any regulations made under this Ordinance may empower the Director to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend any Schedule to the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe, by notice in the Gazette, specifications, standards or additional requirements for the purposes of such regulations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue instructions, directions or codes of practice providing practical guidance with respect to specifications, standards or requirements prescribed by or under such regulations; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: approve any forms required for the purposes of such regulations.

subsection.content: Any instructions, directions or codes of practice referred to in subsection (1)(c) and any amendment thereof shall be published in such manner as may be specified in the regulations or, if not so specified, in such manner as the Director thinks fit; and such publication shall be notified in the Gazette together with advice as to where copies may be obtained.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c) the term Director (處長) in that subsection includes the Deputy Director of Marine.

subsection.content: Any regulations made under this Ordinance and any notice or other instrument made or issued under such regulations may provide for the adoption, for the purposes of the regulations, of standards, specifications or codes of practice issued by The International Maritime Organization or other appropriate authority.

section.name: s112B
section.heading: Supplementary regulation-making power in relation to international agreements applicable to Hong Kong
section.leadIn: For the purposes of giving effect (whether in whole or in part) to any provisions of any international agreement applicable to Hong Kong (including the Convention and the Convention of 1966 referred to in Part IV)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as in force from time to time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so far as the agreement relates to any matter for or in relation to which provision may be made by regulations made under this Ordinance,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: set out or refer directly to those provisions (whether in a Schedule or otherwise); and (Amended 10 of 2009 s. 31)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: specify (whether in a Schedule or otherwise) amendments, modifications or adaptations subject to which those provisions shall have effect.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Power of Secretary to give directions

subsection.content: The Secretary may give to the Director and to any public officer such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the performance or exercise of their respective duties or powers under this Ordinance.
A person to whom a direction is given by the Secretary under subsection (1) shall, in the performance or exercise of his duties or powers under this Ordinance, comply with that direction.

Subject to subsection (3), the Director may, either generally or in any particular case, delegate to any other public officer the performance or exercise on the Director’s behalf of any of the functions imposed or conferred on the Director under this Ordinance.

If any function imposed or conferred on the Director under this Ordinance is performed or exercised by any other public officer, the Director is, unless the contrary is proved, regarded as having delegated to the public officer under subsection (1) the performance or exercise of the function.
No delegation under subsection (1) is to be made of any power under this Ordinance to make subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: functions (職能) includes powers and duties.

subsection.content: The Director may exempt any ship or class of ships from any requirements of this Ordinance or any regulations made under this Ordinance, either absolutely or subject to such conditions as he thinks fit. (Amended 56 of 1990 s. 15)
Where any exemption is conferred under subsection (1) subject to conditions, the exemption shall not have effect unless those conditions are complied with.

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), where a ship not normally engaged on international voyages is required to undertake a single international voyage, the Director may, if he is of the opinion that the ship complies with safety requirements that are adequate for that voyage, exempt the ship from any of the safety requirements imposed by or under this Ordinance. (Amended 56 of 1990 s. 15; 10 of 2009 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The Director may modify any requirement imposed by or under this Ordinance— (Amended 56 of 1990 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with regard to passenger ships plying on any international coasting voyage, if and to the extent that he is satisfied that the risks incurred by passenger ships plying on that voyage are such as to make it unreasonable or unnecessary to require ships so plying to comply with that requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with regard to ships for the time being engaged in any passenger trade in which they are employed in the carriage of large numbers of unberthed passengers, if he is satisfied that compliance with that requirement by ships so engaged is impracticable and to the extent that he is so satisfied that modifications are required by the conditions of the trade.

subsection.leadIn: Any person empowered to exercise the powers contained this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at any reasonable time (or, in a situation which in his opinion is or may be dangerous, at any time)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: enter any premises; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: board any ship which is registered in Hong Kong wherever it may be and any other ship which is in the waters of Hong Kong,

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: make such examination and investigation as he considers necessary for the purpose of performing his functions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: as regards any premises or ship which he has power to enter or board, give a direction requiring that the premises or ship or any part of the premises or ship or any thing in the premises or ship or such a part shall be left undisturbed (whether generally or in particular respects) for so long as is reasonably necessary for the purposes of any examination or investigation under paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
f
g
paragraph.content: in the case of any article or substance which he finds in any such premises or ship and which appears to him to have caused or to be likely to cause danger to health or safety, cause it to be dismantled or subjected to any process or test (but not so as to damage or destroy it unless that is in the circumstances necessary for the purpose of performing the said functions);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any such article or substance as is mentioned in paragraph (g), take possession of it and detain it for so long as is necessary for all or any of the following purposes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to examine it and do to it anything which he has power to do under that paragraph;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to ensure that it is not tampered with before his examination of it is completed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to ensure that it is available for use as evidence in any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: require any person who he has reasonable cause to believe is able to give any information relevant to any examination or investigation under paragraph (c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to attend at a place and time specified by him; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to answer (in the absence of persons other than any persons whom he may allow to be present and a person nominated to be present by the person on whom the requirement is imposed) such questions as he thinks fit to ask; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to sign a declaration of the truth of his answer;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: require the production of, and inspect and take copies of or of any entry in— (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any books or documents which by virtue of any provision of this Ordinance or the Merchant Shipping (Registration) Ordinance (Cap. 415) are required to be kept; and (Amended 74 of 1990 s. 104; 10 of 2009 s. 34 and E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: require any person to afford him such facilities and assistance with respect to any matters or things within that person’s control or in relation to which that person has responsibilities as the inspector considers are necessary to enable him to exercise any of the powers conferred on him by this subsection.

subsection.content: It is hereby declared that nothing in subsection (1) authorizes a person unnecessarily to prevent a ship from proceeding on a voyage.

The Secretary may by regulations make provision as to the procedure to be followed in connexion with the taking of samples under subsection (1)(f) and subsection (6) and provision as to the way in which samples that have been so taken are to be dealt with. (Amended 20 of 1996 s. 9; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 10 of 2009 s. 34)

Where a person proposes to exercise the power conferred by subsection (1)(g) in the case of an article or substance found in any premises or ship, he shall, if so requested by a person who at the time is present in and has responsibilities in relation to the premises or ship, cause anything which is to be done by virtue of that power to be done in the presence of that person unless he considers that its being done in that person’s presence would be prejudicial to the safety of that person.

Before exercising the power conferred by subsection (1)(g), the person shall consult such other persons as appear to him appropriate for the purpose of ascertaining what dangers, if any, there may be in doing anything which he proposes to do under that power.

Where under the power conferred by subsection (1)(h) a person takes possession of any article or substance found in any premises or ship, he shall leave there, either with a responsible person or, if that is impracticable, fixed in a conspicuous position, a notice giving particulars of that article or substance sufficient to identify it and stating that he has taken possession of it under that power; and before taking possession of any such substance under that power he shall, if it is practicable for him to do so, take a sample of the substance and give to a responsible person at the premises or on board the ship a portion of the sample marked in a manner sufficient to identify it.

No answer given by a person in pursuance of a requirement imposed under subsection (1)(i) shall be admissible in evidence against that person or the husband or wife of that person in any proceedings except proceedings in pursuance of section 116(c) in respect of a statement in or a declaration relating to the answer; and a person nominated as mentioned in subsection (1)(i) shall be entitled, on the occasion on which the questions there mentioned are asked, to make representations to the person exercising the powers under this section on behalf of the person who nominated him.

Nothing in this section shall be taken to compel the production by any person of a document of which he would on grounds of legal professional privilege be entitled to withhold production on an order for discovery in an action in the High Court.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Obstruction

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs any person in the exercise of any power conferred on him by section 115; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, does not comply with a requirement imposed in pursuance of section 115 or prevents another person from complying with such a requirement; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (b), makes a statement or signs a declaration which he knows is false, or recklessly makes a statement or signs a declaration which is false, in purported compliance with a requirement made in pursuance of subsection (1)(i) of section 115,

section.continued: commits an offence and shall be liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A Government surveyor may inspect any ship for the purpose of seeing that it complies with this Ordinance or any regulations made thereunder; and if he finds that it does not comply with this Ordinance or regulations he shall give to the owner, agent or master notice in writing stating in what respect it fails to comply and what in his opinion is required to remedy the failure.

Where a notice under subsection (1) has been given to the owner, agent or master of a ship, the ship shall be detained by the Director until a certificate by a Government surveyor is produced to the effect that the failure has been remedied.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Application of section 69
section.content: Where a ship is detained under any provision of this Ordinance (other than Part V) which provides for the detention of a ship until an event specified in that provision occurs, section 69 shall apply as if the ship had been detained under section 68.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Notice to be given to consular officer where proceedings taken in respect of ships not registered in Hong Kong
section.content: Where any ship not registered in Hong Kong is detained under this Ordinance, and where any proceedings are taken under this Ordinance against the owner, agent or master of any such ship, notice shall forthwith be served on the consular officer for the country to which the ship belongs, and such notice shall specify the grounds on which the ship has been detained or the proceedings have been taken.

section.name: s119A
section.heading: Time limit for criminal proceedings
section.content: Notwithstanding anything in the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227) an information or complaint relating to an offence under this Ordinance or any regulations made under this Ordinance which has been committed outside Hong Kong may be laid or made at any time within 2 years from the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of this Ordinance, any document is to be served on any person, that document may be served by any public officer of the Marine Department of the rank of Marine Inspector Class II or above or by any other person authorized in that behalf by the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any case by delivering the document personally to the person to be served, or by leaving it for him at his last place of business or residence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document is to be served on the master of a ship, where there is one, by leaving it for him on board the ship with the person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the ship or a member of the crew of the ship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the document is to be served on a person belonging to a ship, by leaving it for him on board the ship with the master of the ship or with a person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the ship;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the document is to be served on the master of a ship, where there is no master and the ship is in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by serving it on the owner of the ship or his agent residing in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where no such owner or his agent is known or can be found, by affixing the document to the mast or other prominent part of the ship;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: If the document is to be served on the owner of a ship or his agent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by leaving the document for him on board the ship with some person being or appearing to be in charge or command of the ship or a member of the crew of the ship; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving the document for him at the office of the owner or his agent with some person being or appearing to be in charge of the office.

subsection.content: Any document referred to in subsection (1) which is to be served on the owner or master of a ship may be addressed to the owner or master of the ship without specifying the name of the owner or master.

Any person who obstructs the service under this Ordinance of a document on the master of a ship commits an offence and is liable to a fine
at level 2. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

Any owner, agent or master of a ship who is party or privy to an offence under subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s121
section.heading: Payment of remuneration to certain persons
section.content: There shall be paid out of general revenue to any member of a court of survey, other than a public officer, or to any assessor, other than a public officer, such remuneration as may be prescribed in regulations made under this Ordinance or, if no such regulations have been made, as the Chief Executive may direct.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Use of official log-book in evidence

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings for a contravention of this Ordinance, any entry in the official log-book of a ship, deck log-book, engine room log-book or other similar document, or any document purporting to be a copy of any such entry and to be certified as a true copy by any person specified in subsection (2) shall, until the contrary is proved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be admitted in evidence and be sufficient evidence of the matters stated therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of such a copy, be presumed that it is so certified.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the persons who may certify copies of entries in an official log-book, deck log-book, engine room log-book or other similar document are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director or any person authorized by him in writing in that behalf;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a notary public, as defined in the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a consular officer.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that notwithstanding the repeal of sections 59 and 60 and Parts VI and VII of the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281), the following regulations (hereinafter referred to as the specified regulations)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Merchant Shipping (Court of Survey) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Merchant Shipping (Instructions to Surveyors) (Passenger Ships) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. C); and (Amended 24 of 2005 s. 55)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Merchant Shipping (Minimum Passenger Space) Regulations (Cap. 369 sub. leg. E),

subsection.continued: shall, save in so far as they are inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Ordinance or any regulations made thereunder, continue in operation until such time as they are replaced by regulations made under this Ordinance which are expressed to be in substitution of the specified regulations, and shall be deemed for all purposes to have been made under the Ordinance and to be liable to amendment thereby or thereunder.
